content: every since i've started shaving i would get razor bumps. Sometimes not as much, but i always do. I've heard that the military makes you shave every day or at least where theres no hair. my question is if i had to shave and couldnt get a waiver, what would be the best razor and cream to buy, and the techniques from getting bumps. i have a fusion but its only good for nothin, i saw this 6 blade razor by sainsbury which doesnt have that padding like a girls razor usually does. and another thing, i was reading on here and this one guy said he just shaved with out cream, how? lol

content: You are required to shave, if you don't have a waiver. BUT it has never been stated that it has to be with a blade. Have you tried an electric razor? How about the shaving powders that use a plastic "blade" to scrape it off? (it acts like nair). Both of these are viable options. If you still get frequent in-grown hairs from shaving (folliculitis), you can go to sick call and see about getting a shaving profile. Then you would be required to keep any beard to a minimum lenght, typically 1/8-1/4 inch.
reply: You are required to shave, if you don't have a waiver. BUT it has never been stated that it has to be with a blade. Have you tried an electric razor? How about the shaving powders that use a plastic "blade" to scrape it off? (it acts like nair). Both of these are viable options. If you still get frequent in-grown hairs from shaving (folliculitis), you can go to sick call and see about getting a shaving profile. Then you would be required to keep any beard to a minimum lenght, typically 1/8-1/4 inch.

content: quote: Originally posted by vansslim: every since i've started shaving i would get razor bumps. Sometimes not as much, but i always do. I've heard that the military makes you shave every day or at least where theres no hair. my question is if i had to shave and couldnt get a waiver, what would be the best razor and cream to buy, and the techniques from getting bumps. i have a fusion but its only good for nothin, i saw this 6 blade razor by sainsbury which doesnt have that padding like a girls razor usually does. and another thing, i was reading on here and this one guy said he just shaved with out cream, how? lol Look Bud, everyone on here was young once and everyone gave them a hard time so don't take it personal. If you have an electric razor then get some "Williams Lectric shave". It makes the hair stand up more and makes it easier to shave with an electric razor. If I had to shave with a safety razor I would sometimes use regular bar soap. Make a lather in your hand and then smear it on your face. Make certain that you rinse your face after shaving. Almost any canned lather works okay, if it has lanolin it will help shaving a little bit. Also go to the drug store and get a styptic pencil. The styptic pencil will stop the bleeding fast when you nick yourself while shaving .As for the bumps, well I never had that problem. If they bother you or get infected than go on sick call and the Doctor can give you something for it. As for the multi bladed safety razors, I wouldn't even fool with them. They are okay if you have a heavy beard because they help shave closer, but for a light beard forget it, just a waste of money. Okay? Give all of this a try now and let me know how it turns out.
quote: Originally posted by vansslim: every since i've started shaving i would get razor bumps. Sometimes not as much, but i always do. I've heard that the military makes you shave every day or at least where theres no hair. my question is if i had to shave and couldnt get a waiver, what would be the best razor and cream to buy, and the techniques from getting bumps. i have a fusion but its only good for nothin, i saw this 6 blade razor by sainsbury which doesnt have that padding like a girls razor usually does. and another thing, i was reading on here and this one guy said he just shaved with out cream, how? lol
reply: Look Bud, everyone on here was young once and everyone gave them a hard time so don't take it personal. If you have an electric razor then get some "Williams Lectric shave". It makes the hair stand up more and makes it easier to shave with an electric razor. If I had to shave with a safety razor I would sometimes use regular bar soap. Make a lather in your hand and then smear it on your face. Make certain that you rinse your face after shaving. Almost any canned lather works okay, if it has lanolin it will help shaving a little bit. Also go to the drug store and get a styptic pencil. The styptic pencil will stop the bleeding fast when you nick yourself while shaving .As for the bumps, well I never had that problem. If they bother you or get infected than go on sick call and the Doctor can give you something for it. As for the multi bladed safety razors, I wouldn't even fool with them. They are okay if you have a heavy beard because they help shave closer, but for a light beard forget it, just a waste of money. Okay? Give all of this a try now and let me know how it turns out.
title: This is a serious question!

content: Members of some races can't use razor, they get razor bumps. They use a product simliar to Nair, but it's made to be used on the face! Go to any store that has shaving products, they should have shaving needs for men who can't use a razor ie, razor bumps. You can Google it, google has a wealth of information! Good luck! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

content: I can't believe this! NOBODY remembers what you were taught in basic about how to avoid razor burn? It's simple. Rinse your razor in cold water. That's worked for me now for nearly 40 years.
reply: I can't believe this! NOBODY remembers what you were taught in basic about how to avoid razor burn? It's simple. Rinse your razor in cold water. That's worked for me now for nearly 40 years.

content: Wash and dry your face good after each shave helps too... And after-shave maybe to kill bacteria, not to smell good. Nothing a DS enjoys more than a week one trainee that fall out of the barracks smelling like a French W-hore House!! "Is your name Daisy!? Cuz you SMELL like a daisy!! From now on - You are Daisy Slick Sleeve! Right, TRAINEE!!?? I can't HEAR YOU!! SPEAK UP LIKE YOU GOT A PAIR!! LOUDER!!!!!!" Yep, on second thought - use LOTS of after shave!! Wandering and Wondering

content: quote: Originally posted by vansslim: every since i've started shaving i would get razor bumps. Sometimes not as much, but i always do. I've heard that the military makes you shave every day or at least where theres no hair. my question is if i had to shave and couldnt get a waiver, what would be the best razor and cream to buy, and the techniques from getting bumps. i have a fusion but its only good for nothin, i saw this 6 blade razor by sainsbury which doesnt have that padding like a girls razor usually does. and another thing, i was reading on here and this one guy said he just shaved with out cream, how? lol Look Bud, everyone on here was young once and everyone gave them a hard time so don't take it personal. If you have an electric razor then get some "Williams Lectric shave". It makes the hair stand up more and makes it easier to shave with an electric razor. If I had to shave with a safety razor I would sometimes use regular bar soap. Make a lather in your hand and then smear it on your face. Make certain that you rinse your face after shaving. Almost any canned lather works okay, if it has lanolin it will help shaving a little bit. Also go to the drug store and get a styptic pencil. The styptic pencil will stop the bleeding fast when you nick yourself while shaving .As for the bumps, well I never had that problem. If they bother you or get infected than go on sick call and the Doctor can give you something for it. As for the multi bladed safety razors, I wouldn't even fool with them. They are okay if you have a heavy beard because they help shave closer, but for a light beard forget it, just a waste of money. Okay? Give all of this a try now and let me know how it turns out.

It makes the hair stand up more and makes it easier to shave with an electric razor. If I had to shave with a safety razor I would sometimes use regular bar soap. Make a lather in your hand and then smear it on your face. Make certain that you rinse your face after shaving. Almost any canned lather works okay, if it has lanolin it will help shaving a little bit. Also go to the drug store and get a styptic pencil. The styptic pencil will stop the bleeding fast when you nick yourself while shaving .As for the bumps, well I never had that problem. If they bother you or get infected than go on sick call and the Doctor can give you something for it. As for the multi bladed safety razors, I wouldn't even fool with them. They are okay if you have a heavy beard because they help shave closer, but for a light beard forget it, just a waste of money. Okay? Give all of this a try now and let me know how it turns out.
title: This is a serious question!

content: I can't believe this! NOBODY remembers what you were taught in basic about how to avoid razor burn? It's simple. Rinse your razor in cold water. That's worked for me now for nearly 40 years.

content: Wash and dry your face good after each shave helps too... And after-shave maybe to kill bacteria, not to smell good. Nothing a DS enjoys more than a week one trainee that fall out of the barracks smelling like a French W-hore House!! "Is your name Daisy!? Cuz you SMELL like a daisy!! From now on - You are Daisy Slick Sleeve! Right, TRAINEE!!?? I can't HEAR YOU!! SPEAK UP LIKE YOU GOT A PAIR!! LOUDER!!!!!!" Yep, on second thought - use LOTS of after shave!! Wandering and Wondering
